page.title: 13TRANSPORT:CALEDONIAN CANAL
page.content: {THE CALEDONIAN CANAL}IS 60 MILES LONG, THIRTY EIGHT AND HALF MILES OF NATURAL LOCHS, TWENTY ONE AND HALF MILES OF CANAL. IT RUNS ACROSS SCOTLAND FROM CLACHNAHARRY ON THE INVERNESS FIRTH THROUGH THE GREAT GLEN TO CORPACH. IT WAS OPENED IN OCTOBER 1822. THOMAS TELFORD WAS THE PRINCIPAL ENGINEER. AT MUIRTOWN, A SUBURB OF INVERNESS THERE IS A HYDRAULIC SWING BRIDGE FOLLOWED BY 4 STAIRCASE LOCKS. THE CANAL THEN PASSES THE CEMETERY NEAR TOMNAHURICH BRIDGE. A JOURNEY BETWEEN THESE BRIDGES WILL TAKE ABOUT ONE HOUR 12MINUTES.THE CANAL IS OPEN 24HOURS A DAY EXCEPT FOR 3 WEEKS EACH NOVEMBER WHEN IT IS SHUT FOR REPAIR.EVERY 4YEARS THE WATER IS DRAINED TO CHECK THE CANAL BED. MANY KINDS OF BOATS PASS THROUGH THE CANAL BUT TODAY THERE ARE MORE PLEASURE CRUISERS THAN ANY OTHER TYPE OF CRAFT.
